Package org.neo4j.kernel.api

Interface KernelTransaction

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AssertOpen, AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    KernelTransactionImplementation
    public interface KernelTransaction
extends AssertOpen, AutoCloseable
    A transaction with the graph database. Access to the graph is performed via sub-interfaces like Read. Changes made within a transaction are immediately visible to all operations within it, but are only visible to other transactions after the successful commit of the transaction.

    Typical usage: 

     try ( Transaction transaction = db.beginTransaction() )
 {
      ...
      transaction.commit();
 }
 catch ( SomeException e )
 {
      ...
 }

    Typical usage of rollback(), if failure isn't controlled with exceptions: 

     try ( Transaction transaction = db.beginTransaction() )
 {
      ...
      if ( ... some condition )
      {
          transaction.rollback();
      }
      else
      {
          transaction.commit();
      }
 }

    • Field Detail

      • ROLLBACK_ID

        static final long ROLLBACK_ID
        The store id of a rolled back transaction.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        static final long READ_ONLY_ID
        The store id of a read-only transaction.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • commit

        long commit()
     throws TransactionFailureException
        Commit and any changes introduced as part of this transaction. Any transaction that was not committed will be rolled back when it will be closed. When commit() is completed, all resources are released and no more changes are possible in this transaction.
        Returns:
        id of the committed transaction or ROLLBACK_ID if transaction was rolled back or READ_ONLY_ID if transaction was read-only.
        Throws:
        TransactionFailureException

      • rollback

        void rollback()
       throws TransactionFailureException
        Roll back and any changes introduced as part of this transaction. When rollback() is completed, all resources are released and no more changes are possible in this transaction.
        Throws:
        TransactionFailureException

      • dataRead

        Read dataRead()
        Returns:
        The Read operations of the graph. The returned instance targets the active transaction state layer.

      • dataWrite

        Write dataWrite()
         throws InvalidTransactionTypeKernelException
        Returns:
        The Write operations of the graph. The returned instance writes to the active transaction state layer.
        Throws:
        InvalidTransactionTypeKernelException - when transaction cannot be upgraded to a write transaction. This can happen when there have been schema modifications.

      • tokenRead

        TokenRead tokenRead()
        Returns:
        Token read operations

      • tokenWrite

        TokenWrite tokenWrite()
        Returns:
        Token read operations

      • token

        Token token()
        Returns:
        Token read and write operations

      • schemaRead

        SchemaRead schemaRead()
        Returns:
        The schema index read operations of the graph, used for finding indexes.

      • schemaWrite

        SchemaWrite schemaWrite()
                 throws InvalidTransactionTypeKernelException
        Returns:
        The schema index write operations of the graph, used for creating and dropping indexes and constraints.
        Throws:
        InvalidTransactionTypeKernelException

      • locks

        Locks locks()
        Returns:
        The lock operations of the graph.

      • freezeLocks

        void freezeLocks()
        Forbid acquisition and releasing of locks on this transaction. Any call through the kernel API that requires a lock to be acquired or released will throw a FrozenLocksException. Calling `freezeLocks` several times will nest the freezing. A transaction can be opened to new lock interactions again by calling thawLocks() once for every freeze.

      • thawLocks

        void thawLocks()
        throws LocksNotFrozenException
        Allow acquisition and releasing of locks on this transaction. Thaws one nesting of freezeLocks(), which restores the Transaction to normal operation if there has been the same number of freeze and thaw calls.
        Throws:
        LocksNotFrozenException - if the locks were not frozen.

      • cursors

        CursorFactory cursors()
        Returns:
        The cursor factory

      • procedures

        Procedures procedures()
        Returns:
        Returns procedure operations

      • executionStatistics

        ExecutionStatistics executionStatistics()
        Returns:
        statistics about the execution

      • closeTransaction

        long closeTransaction()
               throws TransactionFailureException
        Closes this transaction, roll back any changes if commit() was not called.
        Returns:
        id of the committed transaction or ROLLBACK_ID if transaction was rolled back or READ_ONLY_ID if transaction was read-only.
        Throws:
        TransactionFailureException

      • close

        default void close()
            throws TransactionFailureException
        Closes this transaction, roll back any changes if commit() was not called.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        TransactionFailureException

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Returns:
        true if the transaction is still open, i.e. if close() hasn't been called yet.

      • isClosing

        boolean isClosing()
        Returns:
        true if the transaction is closing, i.e. committing or rolling back.

      • getReasonIfTerminated

        Optional<Status> getReasonIfTerminated()
        Returns:
        Status if markForTermination(Status) has been invoked, otherwise empty optional.

      • isTerminated

        boolean isTerminated()
        Returns:
        true if transaction was terminated, otherwise false

      • markForTermination

        void markForTermination​(Status reason)
        Marks this transaction for termination, such that it cannot commit successfully and will try to be terminated by having other methods throw a specific termination exception, as to sooner reach the assumed point where close() will be invoked.

        Gets associated meta data.
        Returns:
        the meta data

      • acquireStatement

        Statement acquireStatement()
        Acquires a new Statement for this transaction which allows for reading and writing data from and to the underlying database. After the group of reads and writes have been performed the statement must be released.
        Returns:
        a Statement with access to underlying database.

      • indexUniqueCreate

        IndexDescriptor indexUniqueCreate​(IndexPrototype prototype)
                           throws KernelException
        Create unique index which will be used to support uniqueness constraint.
        Parameters:
        prototype - the prototype of the unique index to create.
        Returns:
        IndexReference for the index to be created.
        Throws:
        KernelException

      • securityContext

        SecurityContext securityContext()
        Returns:
        the security context this transaction is currently executing in.
        Throws:
        NotInTransactionException - if the transaction is closed.

        Returns:
        transaction originator info

      • subjectOrAnonymous

        AuthSubject subjectOrAnonymous()
        Returns:
        the subject executing this transaction, or AuthSubject.ANONYMOUS if the transaction is closed.

      • lastTransactionTimestampWhenStarted

        long lastTransactionTimestampWhenStarted()
        Returns:
        The timestamp of the last transaction that was committed to the store when this transaction started.

      • lastTransactionIdWhenStarted

        long lastTransactionIdWhenStarted()
        Returns:
        The id of the last transaction that was committed to the store when this transaction started.

      • getTransactionId

        long getTransactionId()
        Return transaction id that assigned during transaction commit process.
        Returns:
        transaction id.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if transaction id is not assigned yet

      • getCommitTime

        long getCommitTime()
        Return transaction commit time (in millis) that assigned during transaction commit process.
        Returns:
        transaction commit time
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if commit time is not assigned yet

      • overrideWith

        KernelTransaction.Revertable overrideWith​(SecurityContext context)
        Temporarily override this transaction's SecurityContext. The override should be reverted using the returned KernelTransaction.Revertable.
        Parameters:
        context - the temporary SecurityContext.
        Returns:
        KernelTransaction.Revertable which reverts to the original SecurityContext.

      • clocks

        ClockContext clocks()
        Clocks associated with this transaction.

      • ambientNodeCursor

        NodeCursor ambientNodeCursor()
        USE WITH CAUTION: The internal node cursor instance used to serve kernel API calls. If some kernel API call is made while this cursor is used, it might get corrupted and return wrong results.

      • ambientRelationshipCursor

        RelationshipScanCursor ambientRelationshipCursor()
        USE WITH CAUTION: The internal relationship scan cursor instance used to serve kernel API calls. If some kernel API call is made while this cursor is used, it might get corrupted and return wrong results.

      • ambientPropertyCursor

        PropertyCursor ambientPropertyCursor()
        USE WITH CAUTION: The internal property cursor instance used to serve kernel API calls. If some kernel API call is made while this cursor is used, it might get corrupted and return wrong results.

      • isSchemaTransaction

        boolean isSchemaTransaction()
        Returns:
        whether or not this transaction is a schema transaction. Type of transaction is decided on first write operation, be it data or schema operation.

      • pageCursorTracer

        PageCursorTracer pageCursorTracer()
        Get transaction local page cursor tracer
        Returns:
        page cursor tracer

      • memoryTracker

        MemoryTracker memoryTracker()
        Get the memory tracker for this transaction.
        Returns:
        underlying transaction memory tracker

      • getDatabaseId

        UUID getDatabaseId()
        The id of the database which the transaction is connected to.
        Returns:
        database id.

      • getDatabaseName

        String getDatabaseName()
        The name of the database which the transaction is connected to.
        Returns:
        database name.
